statements: SELECT stock_symbol, stock_price FROM stock_prices ORDER BY stock_symbol DESC;
SELECT * FROM stock_prices;
SELECT stock_symbol, stock_price FROM stock_prices WHERE stock_price > 100 ORDER BY stock_price ASC;
SELECT stock_symbol FROM stock_prices WHERE stock_symbol LIKE 'AAPL%';
SELECT AVG(stock_price) AS average_price FROM stock_prices;
SELECT * FROM stock_prices WHERE stock_price > 100 ORDER BY stock_price DESC;
SELECT stock_symbol, stock_price FROM stock_prices WHERE stock_price BETWEEN 50 AND 100 ORDER BY stock_price ASC;
SELECT stock_symbol, MAX(stock_price) AS max_price FROM stock_prices GROUP BY stock_symbol HAVING max_price > 200;
SELECT stock_symbol, AVG(stock_price) AS avg_price FROM stock_prices GROUP BY stock_symbol ORDER BY avg_price DESC;
SELECT stock_symbol, COUNT(*) AS total_rows FROM stock_prices GROUP BY stock_symbol HAVING total_rows > 1 ORDER BY stock_symbol ASC;
SELECT * FROM stocks WHERE id = 1;
SELECT stock_name, stock_price FROM stocks ORDER BY stock_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM stock_updates WHERE update_date < '2022-01-01';
SELECT stock_name, stock_price, last_update FROM stocks WHERE stock_price > 1000;
SELECT stock_name, new_price, update_date FROM stocks JOIN stock_updates ON stocks.id = stock_updates.stock_id ORDER BY update_date ASC;
SELECT * FROM stocks WHERE stock_name = 'AAPL';
SELECT stock_name, stock_price FROM stocks ORDER BY stock_price DESC;
SELECT stock_name, stock_price, last_update FROM stocks WHERE stock_price > 1000 ORDER BY last_update ASC;
SELECT su.update_date, s.stock_name, su.new_price FROM stocks s, stock_updates su WHERE s.id = su.stock_id ORDER BY su.update_date DESC;
SELECT s.stock_name, s.stock_price, su.update_date FROM stocks s JOIN stock_updates su ON s.id = su.stock_id WHERE su.new_price > 1500 ORDER BY su.update_date ASC;
SELECT * FROM stocks;
SELECT stock_name, stock_price FROM stocks WHERE stock_price > 100;
SELECT * FROM stock_updates ORDER BY update_date DESC;
SELECT stock_name, price FROM stocks INNER JOIN stock_history ON stocks.id = stock_history.stock_id;
SELECT stock_name, new_price FROM stocks JOIN stock_updates ON stocks.id = stock_updates.stock_id ORDER BY new_price DESC;
SELECT * FROM stocks ORDER BY stock_name DESC, stock_price ASC
SELECT stock_name, stock_price FROM stocks WHERE stock_price > 100 ORDER BY stock_price DESC
SELECT stock_name, price, update_date FROM stock_history JOIN stocks ON stock_history.stock_id = stocks.id ORDER BY update_date DESC
SELECT stock_name, new_price, update_date FROM stock_updates JOIN stocks ON stock_updates.stock_id = stocks.id WHERE update_date >= '2022-01-01'
SELECT stock_name, stock_price, update_date FROM stocks LEFT JOIN stock_history ON stocks.id = stock_history.stock_id ORDER BY update_date DESC
SELECT * FROM stocks;
SELECT stock_name, price FROM stocks WHERE price > 100;
SELECT stock_name, price FROM stocks ORDER BY price DESC;
SELECT stock_name, price, last_updated FROM stocks WHERE id = 1;
SELECT stock_name, price, last_updated FROM stocks WHERE price < 50 ORDER BY price ASC;
SELECT * FROM stocks;
SELECT stock_name, price FROM stocks WHERE price > 100 ORDER BY price DESC;
SELECT stock_name, last_updated FROM stocks ORDER BY last_updated ASC LIMIT 5;

SELECT s.stock_name, su.new_price, sc.change_amount, sl.log_message FROM stocks s JOIN stock_updates su ON s.id = su.stock_id JOIN stock_changes sc ON s.id = sc.stock_id JOIN stock_logs sl ON s.id = sl.stock_id;
SELECT * FROM stocks WHERE stock_name LIKE 'A%' OR stock_name LIKE '%Z' ORDER BY stock_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM stock_prices WHERE symbol = 'AAPL';
SELECT symbol, price FROM stock_prices WHERE price > 100 ORDER BY price DESC;
SELECT stock_name FROM stocks WHERE stock_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM stock_history WHERE stock_id = 3 AND timestamp > '2022-01-01' ORDER BY timestamp ASC;
SELECT log_message, log_timestamp FROM stock_logs WHERE log_timestamp BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-02-01';
SELECT * FROM stock_prices WHERE price > 100 ORDER BY symbol DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT stock_name, price FROM stocks JOIN stock_prices ON stocks.stock_id = stock_prices.id WHERE stock_name LIKE 'AAPL%' ORDER BY price ASC
SELECT AVG(price) AS average_price, MIN(price) AS min_price, MAX(price) AS max_price FROM stock_prices
SELECT stock_name, COUNT(*) AS total_updates FROM stock_updates JOIN stocks ON stock_updates.stock_id = stocks.stock_id GROUP BY stock_name HAVING total_updates > 5
SELECT stock_id, price, DATE_FORMAT(timestamp, '%Y-%m-%d %H:%i:%s') AS formatted_timestamp FROM stock_history ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 5
